intro: Vandenboschia aphlebioides, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Vandenboschia aphlebioides is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
